meanings.definition: A derogatory term for a person with Down syndrome.
meanings.sent1: Tom felt sad when someone called him a mong at school.
meanings.sent2: It is hurtful to use the word mong to describe someone.
meanings.sent3: The children learned that using the word mong is unkind and disrespectful.
meanings.sent4: She realized the impact of the word mong and vowed never to use it again.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained why calling someone a mong is unacceptable behavior.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Mongolia.
meanings.sent1: In Mongolia, people use the mong to buy goods and services.
meanings.sent2: The exchange rate for the mong is favorable this week.
meanings.sent3: He saved up all his mongs to buy a special gift for his mother.
meanings.sent4: The mong jingled in his pocket as he walked to the market.
meanings.sent5: She carefully counted her mongs before making the purchase.

meanings.definition: A shortened form of the word 'mongrel'.
meanings.sent1: The dog at the shelter was a cute little mong.
meanings.sent2: The mong happily wagged its tail when the visitors approached.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the playful antics of the mong in the park.
meanings.sent4: She adopted a mong from the rescue center and named him Lucky.
meanings.sent5: The mong's mixed breed made it unique and lovable.
